prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 1
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago.
Character 2
Name: Godot
Description: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.
Character 3
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Maya's cousin, and channeling prodigy. She has amazingly powerful spiritual abilities.
Character 4
Name: Bikini
Description: A hearty, motherly nun at Hazakura Temple, a channeling dojo deep in the mountains.
Character 5
Name: Elise Deauxnim
Description: Kind-eyed author and illustrator of picture books. Pearls is huge fan of hers.
Character 6
Name: Iris
Description: A nun at Hazakura Temple. She reminds me so much of "her"...
Character 7
Name: Laurice Deauxnim* (when playing as Wright) → Larry Butz* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Description: Better known as Larry Butz. Current in training as Elise Deauxnim's pupil.
Character 8
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: My friend since grade school. Fell from Dusky Bridge and is currently hospitalized.
Character 9
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 10
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: My mentor, Manfred von Karma's, daughter. Born/raised in Germany. Prosecutor at 13.
Character 11
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: An old friend. Said to be #1 at the D.A.'s office. Studies foreign judicial systems now.
Character 12
Name: Morgan Fey
Description: Older sister of Misty Fey and mother of Pearl and Iris. Is in solitary confinement.
Character 13
Name: ?????? → Dahlia Hawthorne
Description: Morgan Fey's daughter and Iris's twin sister. Her father deals in jewelry apparently.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.* (when playing as Wright) Received from Wright. He wasn't serious when he gave this to me... was he?* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Evidence 1
Name: Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts.* (when playing as Wright) Received from Wright. Something about reading people's hearts... What utter nonsense.* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Evidence 2

Name: Hazakura Temple Map
Description: Shows Hazakura Temple and the surrounding area. Click here for details.
Evidence 4
Name: Hanging Scroll
Description: Shows Misty Fey, Master of the Kurain Technique. Click here for details. Misty Fey's image is obscured by gravy. Click here for details.
Evidence 5
Name: Photo of Elise
Description: Taken by her only pupil, Laurice Deauxnim. She is wearing a white robe and a hood. She was holding a book and a staff. The staff has a crystal sphere attached to it.
Evidence 6
Name: Iris's Hood
Description: A hood that Iris wears at all times. A magical hood said to offer protection from evil spirits. Received before the lights out bell the night of the crime. Protects from evil spirits.
Iris:
If it's alright with you... I would like you to have this.

Phoenix:
But this is your hood...
Evidence 7
Name: Weather Data
Description: A regional weather report for the night of the crime.
Eagle Mountain Weather Data for Feb. 07
Snow, with occasional lightning strikes.

Snow: 7 to approx. 10:50 PM
Lightning: 10 to approx. 11 PM

Around 30 minutes passed between
the fire starting and going out.
Evidence 8
Name: Note to Iris
Description: Found in the Main Hall. Maybe she dropped it? Click here for details.
Evidence 9
Name: Victim's Staff
Description: Carried by Elise Deauxnim when she was alive. Has her fingerprints on it. There is no crystal sphere attached. Has a sword hidden inside. No one knows this except Detective Gumshoe and I. Has a sword hidden inside. The actual weapon used to murder the victim.
Evidence 10
Name: Shichishito
Description: The apparent murder weapon. A seven-branched, jagged sword. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it, but is not the murder weapon.
Evidence 11
Name: Elise's Autopsy Report
Description: Time: 10 - 11 PM. Cause: loss of blood from stab in back. Body fell 10 ft. after death.
Evidence 12
Name: Iris's Testimony
Description: Rang lights out bell at 10 PM and was then in her room until the murder was discovered.
Evidence 13
Name: Crime Photo
Description: The courtyard where Elise Deauxnim was murdered. Click here for details.
Evidence 14
Name: Tracks Photo
Description: Taken that night. [caption] One track is shown leading from Main Gate to Dusky Bridge.
Evidence 15
Name: Larry's Sketch
Description: Horrible sketch of what he saw the night of the crime. Click here for details.
Evidence 16
Name: Crystal Sphere
Description: Found half-covered in snow near Dusky Bridge the night of the crime. Has blood on it. Found on outcropping near Dusky Bridge. Has blood on it. Came from the victim's staff.
Evidence 17
Name: Kurain Master's Talisman
Description: Worn by Elise Deauxnim. Found in the garden of the Inner Temple.
Evidence 18
Name: Burnt Letter
Description: Found by Gumshoe in the Inner Temple incinerator. Click here for details. Orders from Morgan Fey. Opened once before. Click here for details.
Evidence 19
Name: Dagger
Description: Found behind a tree in the Inner Temple garden. The blood is being analyzed now. Found stuck in a pine tree in Inner Temple Garden. The blood doesn't match the victim's.
Evidence 20
Name: Stone Lantern
Description: A lantern from the Inner Temple garden. Was not lit the night of the crime.
Evidence 21
Name: Dusky Bridge Photo
Description: Taken the morning after the crime. Click here for details.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: That night I was helping an acolyte with her training in the Inner Temple. But...
Person: Bikini
Testimony 1
Testimony: Well, as you can see, my back likes to act up. Violently.
Person: Bikini
Testimony 2
Testimony: So, I left Iris to help the acolyte, and returned to Hazakura Temple.
Person: Bikini
Testimony 3
Testimony: Iris came to the Inner Temple. She was dressed exactly as she had been at dinner.
Person: Bikini
Testimony 4
Testimony: There's no bath at the Inner Temple, you see, and I needed a long, hot soak.
Person: Bikini
Testimony 5
Testimony: It was after I had finished, just as I was heading back... that's when I saw it!
Person: Bikini

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Let's analyze Testimony 3:  
Testimony 3  
Testimony: Iris came to the Inner Temple. She was dressed exactly as she had been at dinner.  
Person: Bikini

Now, let's look at the evidence about Iris's clothing. Evidence 6 (Iris's Hood):  
Evidence 6  
Name: Iris's Hood  
Description: A hood that Iris wears at all times. A magical hood said to offer protection from evil spirits. Received before the lights out bell the night of the crime. Protects from evil spirits.

From the description and in-game context, we know Phoenix received Iris's hood *before* the murder took place, meaning Iris could not have been wearing her full habit (her hood) "exactly as she had been at dinner." Bikini's testimony assumes Iris was dressed identically at the Inner Temple as she was at dinner, but the hood was not with her.

Therefore, Testimony 3 and Evidence 6 are in contradiction.

Person: Bikini

Person: Bikini

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Testimony 3 by Bikini states: "Now that you mention it... Iris didn't have her hood on." She is claiming that Iris was not wearing her distinctive hood during the alleged murder.

However, Evidence 6, "Iris's Hood", states it is a hood that Iris wears at all times and it was "received before the lights out bell the night of the crime," i.e., Iris did not have her hood after 10 PM, which implies she may not have been wearing it when seen. But, for this specific contradiction, it's more that the hood was *missing* and returned before 10 PM, so after 10 PM, Iris shouldn't have had it, which supports Bikini's statement.

A more direct contradiction exists between Bikini's Testimony 5 and the physical evidence. In Testimony 5, Bikini states, "The stabbing I saw must have occurred after she was pushed out of her window." This indicates that the victim was stabbed after being pushed from the window, i.e., after a fall from a height (from Mystic Elise's room).

However, Evidence 11, "Elise's Autopsy Report," says: "Cause: loss of blood from stab in back. Body fell 10 ft. after death." This means the victim was stabbed first and then her body fell. Bikini's statement is the reverse: that the fall happened first, and *then* the stabbing.

Therefore, the pair where Testimony 5 contradicts Evidence 11 is:

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Let's look for a contradiction between any one piece of evidence and one testimony.

Testimony 3 from Bikini: "I've never seen so much blood before..."
Evidence 10 (Shichishito): "The apparent murder weapon. A seven-branched, jagged sword. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it, but is not the murder weapon."
Evidence 9 (Victim's Staff): "Carried by Elise Deauxnim when she was alive. Has her fingerprints on it. There is no crystal sphere attached. Has a sword hidden inside. No one knows this except Detective Gumshoe and I. Has a sword hidden inside. The actual weapon used to murder the victim."

So Bikini describes a scene with "so much blood." However, the real murder weapon (Victim's Staff) is a concealed sword and was not publicly known; the weapon the witness would have seen–the Shichishito–was not actually used to kill Elise and would not have caused so much blood due to not being the murder weapon. This means the witness saw a scene with a large amount of blood despite the weapon not being used to inflict the wound at that moment, raising a contradiction between her testimony about the blood and the evidence that shows what weapon was actually used.

Therefore,

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Testimony 3 from Bikini claims: "It takes 15 minutes to walk to Dusky Bridge, but less than 5 using one of those!" This suggests that it's possible for someone to get from the Temple to Dusky Bridge quickly with a snowmobile.

However, Evidence 14, Tracks Photo, shows only a single set of snowmobile tracks leading from the Main Gate to Dusky Bridge, indicating the snowmobile was only used once in that path, not back and forth in the manner implied. This creates a contradiction: if multiple trips with the snowmobile happened during the relevant time frame, there should be multiple sets of tracks.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I went to the shack at around 9, so it would have been about 10:30 PM...
Person: Butz

Person: Butz

Person: Butz

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Testimony 3 from Butz states: "There was still some thunder, but I went right away to check it out." According to the Weather Data (Evidence 7), the lightning (and presumably thunder) only lasted between 10:00 and 11:00 PM:

Lightning: 10 to approx. 11 PM

However, Butz claims he left "right away to check it out" after seeing Dusky Bridge on fire. The bridge was struck by lightning at 10:45 PM per the Weather Data, and Butz claims he left immediately after noticing the fire. Butz's first testimony says he went to the shack "at around 9, so it would have been about 10:30 PM..." Thus, if he left for the bridge right after the fire started (at 10:45 PM), the thunder should have been stopping, but he says "there was still some thunder" as he was on his way to the bridge.

But the key contradiction is with the Weather Data: A regional weather report for the night of the crime. Snow: 7 to approx. 10:50 PM. Lightning: 10 to approx. 11 PM. Lightning struck Dusky Bridge at 10:45. 

Butz says he went out right away after seeing the flash and fire (Testimony 3), yet the snow pretty much stopped around 10:50. In Testimony 1, he says the flash almost blinded him while under his bedding (suggesting he was indoors), and in Testimony 0 he says he went to the shack at around 9, so it would have been about 10:30 PM. Therefore, if he went to the shack at 9, and then went to the bridge after 10:45 or so, then the thunder comment in Testimony 3 lines up, but the contradiction is more prominent if you look at Testimony 1 ("I was lying under my bedding when a white flash almost blinded me!")—he should not have been able to see the flash while inside the shack, unless the windows were uncovered and he was paying attention. However, based on the prompt, the most technically accurate contradiction is between Butz's statements of the timing of his movements compared to the Weather Data.

The clearest contradiction is that Butz claims he went "right away" to check out the fire, but according to the Weather Data, the snow was heavy until about 10:50 PM, yet Butz says "it had pretty much stopped snowing" and that his travel time to the bridge was about five minutes. If he left right away, the snow would not have "pretty much stopped." Thus:

Testimony 0
Testimony: I'm a Deauxnim. I'm an artist! What do you think I was doing?
Person: Butz
Testimony 1

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Let's analyze the options:

Evidence 15: "Larry's Sketch" is referenced in Larry Butz's testimonies as the result of his "frenzy of art" (Testimony 1 and 3). In Testimony 3, he says "The shock and awe that I was feeling... I transferred it all directly onto the page!" This implies his sketch accurately captures what he saw, and that he was there the entire time as the crime unfolded.

However, Evidence 14: "Tracks Photo" shows only "one track leading from Main Gate to Dusky Bridge," which contradicts any claim that Larry was present in front of Dusky Bridge, as there aren't tracks indicating he had access to where he claimed to be sketching, especially during snowy conditions as indicated in the Weather Data.

But we are to supply only one pair. Reviewing further, the most explicitly contradictory evidence and testimony pair is:

Evidence 13 (Crime Photo) or Evidence 15 (Larry's Sketch) vs. Testimony 2: Larry claims to have seen "Iris flying! Her white hood fluttering!" However, Evidence 6 (Iris's Hood) shows that Iris gave her hood to Phoenix before the crime occurred, so she could not have been seen wearing a white hood by the bridge at the time Larry is describing.

Therefore, the contradiction is between:

Evidence 6 (Iris's Hood): which says Iris gave her hood away before the crime,
Testimony 2: "I saw Iris flying! Her white hood fluttering!"

Final answer:
